posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked:
The post introduces **maple-sim**, a physics-based simulation library for Java-based FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC) robot simulations. Built on the dyn4j engine, maple-sim enhances testing processes by incorporating realistic interactions between robots, game pieces, and opponent robots. Designed for virtual environments, it eliminates the need for physical robots while offering detailed dynamics such as swerve-drive simulations, vision integration, and projectile modeling.

### Key Features:
- **Swerve-Drive Simulation**: Models drivetrain forces and field interactions
- **Odometry & Vision Simulation**: Integrates real-world odometry errors with vision systems
- **Game Pieces & Intake Simulation**: Tests intake mechanisms and piece interactions
- **Projectile Simulation**: Models game piece physics and shooter control optimization
- **Opponent Simulation**: Practices defensive and offensive strategies

Visit [this link](https://github.com/Shenzhen-Robotics-Alliance/maple-sim) for more details and examples.

posts.name: Andrew Schreiber
posts.cooked: Oooh you have my interest. Very cool.

posts.name: DIBBY
posts.cooked: This looks interesting.

posts.name: Daniel C.
posts.cooked:
I'll be happy to help with development if you need it. Btw, I think it might be smarter to design the library in a way that doesn't force specific structures on the subsystems or I/O. From the documentation, it appears that using GyroSimulation and SwerveModuleSimulation are necessary for the simulation to work, and I'm curious if there's a more flexible approachperhaps a generic DriveSim class that takes module states and gyro heading, with GyroSimulation, SwerveModuleSimulation, and BrushlessMotorSimulation serving as optional utility classes.

Additionally, I believe the library should stick to one design pattern, either inheritance or subclassing, not mixing both. For example, IntakeSimulation uses inheritance, while GyroSimulation and SwerveModuleSimulation use subclassing.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Your suggestions are really helpful, and Im excited to collaborate with you on the project. Ill definitely explore the choice between inheritance and subclassing more carefully, as youre rightmixing the two is not a good practice. Ill also set up a Discord group soon to make collaboration easier. This is my first time building a library as a high school student, so I understand that some parts of the code are rough or buggy. If you spot any areas that could be improved, I would greatly appreciate any feedback or suggestions.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Currently, **maple-sim** is developed and maintained by a **single student**. Woah! Great work

posts.name: Ali Efe Kerimolu
posts.cooked: nice work

Honestly, its amazing how far you've come doing this alone! The number of people using AdvantageKit has been truly impressive this year. I'm incredibly proud of how many teams have successfully utilized your tool. Your efforts are likely to play a key role in helping all of FRC, and Id love to collaborate on integrating this into YAGSL.

posts.name: James Rechs
posts.cooked: Once or twice a week, I check Catrix from Iron Maples chiefdelphi account and am amazed each time at how much cooler their work has become compared to the previous week. This is truly impressive work!

I love this project and have been closely monitoring it for quite some time. Id also love to contribute to its development. Yesterday, I successfully integrated it into my 2025 AdvantageKit advanced swerve drive. Im committed to addressing any issues or bugs I encounter. If you need me to assist with writing any code for this project, Ill do my best!

posts.name: Owen Flanagan
posts.cooked: This is so cool! I've been searching for a tool like this and am really excited one is being created. Please share if you're recruiting developersId love to contribute!

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked:
The text has been cleaned up to focus solely on the intended message while preserving its original meaning. Here is the refined version:

---

The community expresses gratitude for the willingness of many to assist with development efforts. The team acknowledges the importance of feedback and is committed to improving based on constructive criticism.

Several development plans were discussed, including the introduction of an **EasySwerveDriveSimulation** module designed to simplify simulation integration for teams. Additionally, the team explored restructuring the **IntakeSimulation** codebase to adopt a more robust subclasses-based architecture. A GitHub issue template was also requested to facilitate consistent reporting of bugs and contributions.

Furthermore, the team is considering publishing their library more efficiently, aiming to streamline the process on platforms like GitHub Packages. Lastly, the team invited others to join their Discord community for discussions and collaboration.

--- 

This version removes all HTML tags, unnecessary elements, and maintains a clear, professional tone while preserving the core message.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Ive also been looking over your library to figure out the best way to integrate it into PurpleLib.
Hey, I'd love to help with this, feel free to message me! This seems like a great project, and I'm going to try my best to implement it next year on my team.
Hope we can get a good release of YAGSL with IronMaple soon! Let me know if you need more help with vendordep.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Thank you so much for all your help! In just three days, youve managed to accomplish what I couldnt finish in the past three months!
No problem! I learned a lot about Gradle and the WPILib vendordeps in the process. I need to redo parts of my Gradle config for YAGSL soon. I cant wait to see how many teams use MapleSim this year!

accepted_answer.excerpt: v0.3.3: Reef Simulation! Scoring CORAL on REEF, in Simulation! Introducing the ability to simulate CORAL scoring on REEF elements in simulation! The simulation now detects when a CORAL contacts the REEF and models the interaction, providing a realistic environment for testing and refining scoring…
